overview:
Rob Wrubel is a former entrepreneur and business leader who joined the financial planning community in 2001. He has developed a practice working with individuals, non-profit organizations and businesses on key areas of financial planning including, asset management and asset protection, special needs planning, wealth transfer and executive compensation.

Rob actively works to create a better community in Colorado Springs through his direct support of several organizations. He currently serves on the Ronald McDonald House Charities of Colorado Springs board of directors and chairs the finance committee. Rob recently finished his term as Past President of the board of directors for CASA of the Pikes Peak Region. He has had the great pleasure to be involved in the successful completion of a capital campaign to restore the Pikes Peak Library’s historic Carnegie Library. Rob also invests his time in community activities promoting a better economic climate, including working with the Chamber of Commerce, the Colorado Springs Investor Network, the Peak Venture Group and Celebrate Technology.
